text: If you’re able, take a moment this weekend to call a friend you haven’t talked to in a while. Send a message to your grandparents. At times like these we need to make sure we’re social distancing, but not emotional distancing.

The press HATED that, three months ago, we had the lowest African-American & Hispanic unemployment ever recorded. Now that we’re in the midst of a global pandemic—which originated in Wuhan, not the Oval Office—too many in the press are giddy with glee. #RootForAmerica https://twitter.com/glennkesslerwp/status/1246531962191384577 QT @GlennKesslerWP Line from Trump's State of the Union address that did not age well: "“Incredibly, the average unemployment rate under my administration is lower than any administration in the history of our country.”

It's outrageous that during this time essential workers are forced to work without the proper safety equipment. I stand with @sproutsfm workers demanding PPE, hazard pay, sick days, and a safety committee now. Add your name to their petition: https://www.change.org/p/sprouts-farmers-market-stand-with-sprouts-workers-covid-19-protections-for-workers-our-families-now?utm_source=share_petition&utm_medium=custom_url&recruited_by_id=7d79ea30-7393-11ea-986e-1752db09161a

Coronavirus is further shedding light on racial disparities that already existed in our nation.

This alarming new report is exactly why I joined my colleagues this week calling on the HHS to collect racial and ethnic data for coronavirus patients.

As I said on #RolandMartinUnfiltered this week, this virus is predatory. It preys on people with pre-existing conditions, and as we're learning, it's hitting our Black communities hard. I'm in D.C. focused on getting the resources needed to keep our communities safe. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EUyj5mzXkAAtqCI.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1246551079455789061/vid/480x270/oto1t3KQAwbARfUQ.mp4?tag=13

RT @MarkLevineNYC Michigan has just started reporting on coronavirus cases by race.

African Americans are 14% of that state's population but 40% of deaths.

This pandemic is reflecting--and exacerbating--inequality.

NYC should publish this data as well, so we get the picture here. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EUtOUIIWAAA0OJ1.png

Fifth issue is that In calculating avg monthly payroll to determine #Ppploans amount we need @SBAgov to make clear our intent when writing the bill that gross payroll would be applied to calculation to ensure federal tax withholding & FICA burden isn’t on #smallbusiness 9/13

On Friday we had various & extensive conversations with @SBAgov & @USTreasury about the issues that emerged on day one of #PPPloans. I expect that early next week they will be releasing additional guidance that should provide clarity & help resolve many of these issues 3/13

RT @TheKingCenter Today, on the 52nd anniversary of the day he was assassinated, we remember #MLK’s love & legacy. 

We are inspired by his courage & consistency to purpose.

We believe that his teachings & examples of compassionate action are relevant & applicable.

The coronavirus does not differentiate based on immigration status and our economic and health response must not either. Guaranteeing all residents the assistance they need makes us safer, stronger, and is the morally right thing to do.

Third issue is that in order for lenders to confidently participate they need further clarity on: 
- @SBAgov affiliation rules for #SmallBusiness & 501(c)(3) 
- Inconsistency on general eligiblity requirements for #Ppploans 
I expect that very early next week as well.

7/13

RT @ninaturner 52 years ago, Rev. Dr. #MLK was assassinated. Despite great ridicule & resistance from the status quo, he continued to fight for justice!🙏🏾👊🏾

“God never intended for one group of people to live in superfluous inordinate wealth, while others live in abject deadening poverty.” http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EUxBgdHWsAA9lJX.jpg

Anxiety of #smallbusiness over crisis is understandable

Please don’t be discouraged by 1st day challenges of #PPP

Feds only had 7 days to launch brand new program from scratch to help over 60 million potential applicants

Process must/will improve fast
 https://www.wsj.com/articles/small-business-loan-program-makes-bumpy-start-11585939613

Second issue is that because of requirement in @SBAgov interim final rule that lenders hold loans for 7 weeks before they can be purchased,we will need a purchase mechanism through @USTreasury or @federalreserve ASAP in order for community banks & FinTech to make #Ppploans 6/13

RT @BerniceKing He didn’t die of natural causes. 

My father was murdered for working to end racism, war and poverty and for speaking truth to White people in power who didn’t want to share it. 

The evils he opposed then still exist now. 

#COVID19 is revealing just how much. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EUw3AC_XsAA6NTU.jpg

It’s been 52 years since Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. was assassinated. His tragic death came at a time when he was in full swing pushing for economic and racial justice for workers.

Let’s honor his legacy by continuing his fight for safe working conditions and a living wage.

The late-night firing of Inspector General Atkinson is a brazen act against a patriotic public servant who has honorably performed his duty to protect the Constitution and our national security, as required by the law and by his oath. https://www.speaker.gov/newsroom/4320-2

When you launch something this unprecedented & far reaching,just 7 days after it became law,you are going to have some problems

The GOOD NEWS is every problem we saw on Day One of #Ppploans can be fixed

We will stay on it to make sure it gets better each day forward
 13/13

The biggest thing you could do today is a small act of kindness.
https://www.nj.com/news/j66j-2020/03/0edc4317695474/coronavirus-no-match-for-this-100yearold-veterans-birthday-neighbors-threw-him-a-parade.html
All frontline workers—including health care workers, farm workers, first responders, domestic workers, and grocery workers—deserve hazard pay for the duration of this pandemic.

"Darkness cannot drive out darkness, only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate, only love can do that."

Thinking of these words today. More light and more love—a radical love—is how we'll build the beloved community that Dr. King imagined. https://twitter.com/NBCNews/status/1246449219361222658 QT @NBCNews Martin Luther King Jr. was assassinated on April 4, 1968. Trump's intentional failure to appoint inspectors general makes clear his hostility to being held accountable. This is especially irresponsible w/ the unprecedented scale of the federal response to COVID-19.

I'm demanding Trump move quickly to fill IG vacancies. This can't wait.

Our country is facing its worst crisis in modern history. Congress must pass, in the very near future, the boldest piece of legislation ever written in modern history. Over 50 days ago I called for public hearings so Americans could hear directly from current Trump admin officials about the coronavirus.

Trump knew the severity of the situation about 90 days ago—and failed to swiftly act.

More Americans are dying due to his incompetence. https://twitter.com/washingtonpost/status/1246432685209387008 QT @washingtonpost It took 70 days from initial notification for Trump to treat the coronavirus not as a distant threat or harmless flu strain, but as a lethal force poised to kill tens of thousands. 

That period now stands as critical time that was squandered. https://trib.al/nWQ2sFE

The Trump administration needs to stop using a global pandemic as cover for political revenge. It’s corrupt—and it threatens our national security. 
https://www.npr.org/2020/04/03/827195027/president-trump-fires-intelligence-community-inspector-general-michael-atkinson

52 years ago, the course of American history changed when we lost a great leader—but his dream lives on. Today and every day, we are the heirs of Dr. King’s dream and we are called to continue fighting for social, racial, and economic justice. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EUyQRUNXsAAvfND.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1246515511187378176/vid/480x270/3R5ooB1X3WzxduZe.mp4?tag=13

Day one saw complications you would expect with unprecedented $349 BILLION emergency plan passed just 7 days ago

Despite this as of 6:06 pm Friday 13,669 #SmallBusiness owners received #Ppploans valued at more than $4.3B 

However a number of outstanding issues to address 2/13

The day before he was assassinated, Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. said these words: “Only when it is dark enough, can you see the stars.”

Those words are especially meaningful today. No matter how dark these days may seem, we will get through it.

If our farmworkers fall ill, we go hungry. Our health and wellbeing are all interconnected.

We must put an end to their cramped, impoverished conditions, and provide free health care, paid sick leave, and good wages—regardless of immigration status.
https://www.nytimes.com/2020/04/03/opinion/coronavirus-farm-workers.html

Grateful Californians are leading the way and staying home if they’re able. Keep it up. We all need to do what we can to flatten the curve. 
https://twitter.com/washingtonpost/status/1245410622281572352 QT @washingtonpost Social distancing works. The earlier the better, California and Washington data shows. https://trib.al/WjarWYE

Yes rules for #PPPloans posted late Thu by @USTreasury b/c original rules too complicated

And yes many lenders still confused

Confusion being addressed & online lenders starting soon

This is a new program launched with just 7 days, it must/will improve

https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/powerpost/paloma/the-finance-202/2020/04/03/the-finance-202-banks-struggle-with-confusing-rules-on-small-business-stimulus-loans/5e8668db602ff10d49adbd23/?tid=ss_tw

Eighth issue is money. Based on the demand we saw on Day One it is clear we will need more money for #PPP by late May.

Our rough estimate is that if 2/3 of the lenders that will participate in #PPPloans aren’t up & running yet,the $349 billion will run out around 6 June. 12/13

ATTENTION Lenders, #SmallBusiness & media interested in #Ppploans. The following 13 part thread outlines many of the impediments we saw on day one of the program & how they can/will be fixed. 

I apologize for the length of the thread but important details below. 1/13

This is incredible. Thank you for sharing, Stevie. He is a hero and an inspiration for how we can do the most good in a critical time of need. #JerseyStrong https://twitter.com/trippie/status/1246074163686760448 QT @trippie @CoryBooker My middle school shop teacher - who is still teaching up in Newton - developed and is 3d printing face shields for healthcare workers. 💗 https://www.dailyrecord.com/story/news/columnists/mike-kelly/2020/03/31/coronavirus-nj-robotics-teacher-produces-masks-doctors-nurses-battling-covid-19/2930495001/

He sounds like a hero to me. Thanks for sharing, Jessica. All the best to you and your family. https://twitter.com/JessicaKia/status/1246075227693514754 QT @JessicaKia @CoryBooker My community is just in my house currently - so not sure if this counts - but I think my husband @Raman_Kia is a hero. 

We are teaching 3 kids - 2 that have special needs -and he has been the BEST teacher/dad, while also running two small businesses from home. 👏❤️ http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EUryztjWAAAeKzd.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EUryztqXgAArE5Y.jpg

Sixth issue is that E-Tran, the @SBAgov internal system for loan applications has been slow due to the volume of applications Friday. 

SBA has contracted with Amazon Web Services to ensure E-Tran system issues are resolved moving forward.  10/13
